pages.text: $(bold)Aquaculture$()$(br)$(br)Aquaculture expands fishing to add a bunch of new fish. It also adds upgraded fishing rods with higher durability.$(br)$(br)It also adds a new material, $(bold)Neptunium$(), which when crafted into armor and tools, offers various benefits underwater.
For more information, check the Aquaculture wiki: $(l:https://github.com/TeamMetallurgy/Aquaculture/wiki)Link

$(bold)Farmer's Delight$()$(br)$(br)Adds new ways to cook food, and a ton of new food to cook.$(br)$(br)It also offers a way to improve the default farmland, new crops, new tools, decorations, and many new blocks.
$(bold)Pam's HarvestCraft 2$()$(br)$(br)Adds a bunch of new foods, like Epic Bacon.
$(bold)Croptopia$()$(br)$(br)is much like Pam's HarvestCraft 2. It adds a lot of new foods.
$(bold)Cooking for Blockheads$()$(br)$(br)Adds a multi-block kitchen to cook food in unique ways.
If you want to know what you can cook in $(bold)Cooking for Blockheads$(), take a look at this book.
A variant of the recipe book that shows $(bold)all$() Cooking for Blockheads recipes.
Looking for new foods to make? Try taking a look inside the $(bold)Food Book$().

Another mod to be aware of is $(bold)Spice of Life$(). It doesn't add any food on its own, but will permanently increase your max health as you eat more and more $(bold)unique$() food (meaning you can't just cheese it by eating 5,000 steaks; it has to be unique recipes).
